Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and strategic Indirect Purchase Head to lead and manage the indirect procurement operations for our newly established mega factory in Delhi. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of indirect procurement, including capital expenditures (Capex), operational expenditures (Opex), sundry purchases, administrative purchases, and packaging material procurement. This role requires a strong understanding of supply chain management, cost optimization strategies, and vendor management practices within the electronics or manufacturing industry. Strategic Sourcing and Procurement: Develop and implement a comprehensive indirect procurement strategy aligned with the company's objectives and growth plans for the mega factory. Identify and evaluate potential suppliers, negotiate favorable terms and conditions, and establish long-term partnerships with key vendors for indirect materials and services. Manage the entire procurement lifecycle, including requisition processing, vendor selection, contract negotiations, and order placement. Continuously explore opportunities for cost savings, process improvements, and operational efficiencies within the indirect procurement function. 2. Capital Expenditure (Capex) Management: Oversee the procurement of manufacturing equipment, machinery, tools, and other capital assets required for the mega factory's operations. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as engineering, production, and project management, to understand project requirements, timelines, and budgets for capital expenditures. Ensure compliance with company policies, regulatory requirements, and industry standards throughout the Capex procurement process. 3. Operational Expenditure (Opex) Management: Manage the procurement of indirect materials, services, and consumables required for the day-to-day operations of the mega factory, including maintenance, repair, and operations (MRO) supplies. Optimize inventory levels, implement effective inventory management practices, and ensure the timely availability of operational materials. Analyze and control operational expenditures, identifying opportunities for cost savings and process improvements. 4. Sundry, Administrative, and Packaging Material Procurement: Oversee the procurement of office supplies, stationery, furniture, and other administrative materials required for the smooth functioning of the organization. Manage the procurement of packaging materials, ensuring compliance with product specifications, regulatory requirements, and industry standards. Continuously evaluate and streamline procurement processes for sundry, administrative, and packaging materials to enhance efficiency and cost-effectiveness. 5. Vendor Management and Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers and vendors, fostering a collaborative and mutually beneficial partnership. Conduct regular performance reviews and evaluations of suppliers, ensuring adherence to quality standards, delivery timelines, and contractual obligations. Implement vendor management strategies, including supplier risk assessments, supplier development programs, and contingency planning. 6. Team Leadership and Development: Build and lead a high-performing indirect procurement team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. Provide mentorship, training, and professional development opportunities to team members, ensuring they stay up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging trends. Promote a collaborative and cross-functional working environment, facilitating effective communication and information sharing across teams. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data and make informed decisions. Strong leadership and team management capabilities, with the ability to motivate and develop team members. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Proficiency in using procurement software, enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, and other relevant tools and technologies. Knowledge of relevant industry regulations, compliance requirements, and best practices in procurement and supply chain management for the electronics or manufacturing industry. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing business needs.
